parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

datasetStructure: One record per planned constant assessment period

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.TDORDER

datasetVariables.description: A number given to ensure ordinal sequencing of the planned assessment schedules within a trial.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence of Planned Assessment Schedule
datasetVariables.name: TDORDER

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.TDANCVAR

datasetVariables.description: A reference to the date variable name that provides the start point from which the planned disease assessment schedule is measured. This must be a referenced from the ADaM ADSL dataset (e.g., "ANCH1DT"). Note: TDANCVAR will contain the name of a reference date variable.
datasetVariables.label: Anchor Variable Name
datasetVariables.name: TDANCVAR

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.TDSTOFF

datasetVariables.description: A fixed offset from the date provided by the variable referenced in TDANCVAR. This is used when the timing of planned cycles does not start on the exact day referenced in the variable indicated in TDANCVAR. The value of this variable will be either zero or a positive value and will be represented in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariables.label: Offset from the Anchor
datasetVariables.name: TDSTOFF

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.TDTGTPAI

datasetVariables.description: The planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Assessment Interval
datasetVariables.name: TDTGTPAI

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.TDMINPAI

datasetVariables.description: The lower limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Assessment Interval Minimum
datasetVariables.name: TDMINPAI

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.TDMAXPAI

datasetVariables.description: The upper limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Assessment Interval Maximum
datasetVariables.name: TDMAXPAI

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable TD.TDNUMRPT

datasetVariables.description: This variable must represent the maximum number of actual assessments for the analysis that this disease assessment schedule describes. In a trial where the maximum number of assessments is not defined explicitly in the protocol (e.g., assessments occur until death), TDNUMRPT should represent the maximum number of disease assessments that support the efficacy analysis encountered by any subject across the trial at that point in time.
datasetVariables.label: Maximum Number of Actual Assessments
datasetVariables.name: TDNUMRPT

description: A trial design domain that provides information on the protocol-specified disease assessment schedule, to be used for comparison with the actual occurrence of the efficacy assessments in order to determine whether there was good compliance with the schedule.
label: Trial Disease Assessments
name: TD
